title: Planetmath home page
content:
[PlanetMath](https://planetmath.org) is a virtual community which aims to help make mathematical knowledge more accessible. PlanetMath's content is created collaboratively: the main feature is the mathematics encyclopedia with entries written and reviewed by members.

Although PlanetMath is not seeing any new content now, it has accumulated a wealth of semi-structured knowledge with the help of its community of about 24,000 people with various maths interests. With an emphasis on rigor, openness, pedagogy, real-time and interlinked content, PlanetMath has accumulated over 9000 entries containing information on a wide range of Mathematics topics. 

We, at Sophize, are bringing this high-quality knowledge store into our platform. Structured knowledge extracted from the entries is being used to create a network of information that spans across encyclopedias, research papers, formal systems are more. This network will aid our users in various situations such as a) looking-up Mathematical concepts while reading a research article b) finding existing and developing new proofs c) referencing a definition/theorem while engaging in a discussion.

The following is a small sample from over 4000 definitions that we have extracted from PlanetMath:
> - #T_LevelSet
> - #T_Groupoid
> - #T_HodgeTheory
> - #T_TangentOfCircle
> - #T_SymmetricAlgebra
> - #T_FermatNumbers

We have also extracted hundreds of theorems - many along with their proofs
> - #P_HilbertBasisTheorem
> - #P_BohrMollerupTheorem
> - #P_WilsonsTheorem
> - #P_PythagoreanTheorem
> - #P_RiemannsRemovableSingularityTheorem
> - #P_CatalansIdentity
> - #P_AdosTheorem
> - #P_HerbrandsTheoremfirstOrderLogic

Although we have been able to incorporate over 70% PlanetMath entries so far, we are continuing to extract more data, fixing formatting issues, and generating interlinks between the entries.
